abstract: Why can’t TVs get Internet content? Blame years of tortuous negotiations between TV makers and the cable industry over issues like the channel guide.
snippet: Why can’t TVs get Internet content? Blame years of tortuous negotiations between TV makers and the cable industry over issues like the channel guide.
lead_paragraph: At a recent press breakfast, someone asked top executives of Sony Electronics about their plans to let their televisions show video delivered by the Internet. While the company has an early effort, called the Bravia Internet Link, Stan Glasgow, the president of Sony Electronics in the United States, said the company can now introduce better products because it has reached an agreement with the cable industry.

headline.main: How Comcast Controls Sony’s Internet TV Plans
